text.sentence: We think COP's threeQfifteen result will have a neutral to slightly negative impact on the shares' near term performance.

Despite the improving operating performance and the substantial cost reductions that have already been achieved, the market remains sceptical about the company's ability to achieve cash flow neutrality in two thousand seventeen under a dollar sixty Brent price environment.

While the reduced FYfifteen capital spending guidance in conjunction with a modestly higher FYfifteen production outlook is a good combination, we think investors will instead focus their attention towards the just announced Dec tenth conference call where the company will unveil its two thousand sixteen production/capex plan.

Total threeQfifteen production averaged one thousand five hundred fifty four mboe/d, compared to guidance of one thousand five hundred ten Â­ one thousand five hundred fifty mboe/d, and our estimate of one thousand five hundred forty two mboe/d.
Unfortunately, the robust production performance did not translate into strong financial results.
Cash flow from operations before changes in working capital was only dollar one.six billion or an annual run rate of dollar six.four billion, compared to twoQfifteen at dollar two.three billion.
While oil prices were down q/q and COP's threeQ turnarounds hit relatively oil intensive production areas such as the UK and Alaska, we think this is causing concern among investors.
That said, we continue to believe COP offers one of the better risk reward tradeoffs among the mega cap majors.
Based on our analyses, we estimate COP's free cash flow yield after capex could exceed CVX and XOM starting two thousand sixteen, while COP continues to trade at a substantial discount to its peers.
We also continue to believe its North America unconventional oil portfolio, which spans across the Eagle Ford, Bakken, and Permian plays, is unmatched among the Super Majors.

COP believes it has around sixteen billion barrels of resource producible at below dollar sixty/bl Brent and another eight billion boe could be produced between dollar sixty dollar seventy five Brent.

As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report.
Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

Reasonable underlying decline rate and production outlook raise investors' confidence level that the company's strategic transition could work if executed successfully.
We believe the company could become operationally self funded by two thousand seventeen/two thousand eighteen under a dollar one hundred/bl Brent oil environment.
Our upside case assumes a long term Brent price deck of dollar one hundred/bl in our NAV analysis from our current assumption of dollar eighty dollar ninety/bl Brent.
Our downside scenario assumes a long term oil price deck of dollar sixty/bl in our NAV analysis from our current assumption of dollar eighty dollar ninety/bl Brent.

Although we think the shares of the oil majors have already bottomed in late September relative to the market, we think the shares' near term upside may be limited after the subsequent sharp outperformance .
We estimate the group now reflects a long term oil price deck of dollar seventy dollar seventy five Brent or dollar sixty five dollar seventy WTI.

While we continue to think that the global oil market will likely average dollar eighty dollar ninety per barrel over the next decade, we think it unlikely the market will be willing to value the sector at more than dollar seventy five Brent in the next twelve months, given the current future strip averaging only dollar fifty four and dollar fifty nine for Brent in two thousand sixteen and two thousand seventeen and dollar fifty and dollar fifty three for WTI, respectively.

That said, we think the sector's valuation will improve sharply over the next three four years as the global oil market demand and supply returns to a tighter balance by late two thousand seventeen/two thousand eighteen.
Over the next six twelve months, we expect the global oil market to resemble a tug of war between competing forces, likely leading to continued price volatility.
We expect Brent to range between dollar forty five dollar seventy and WTI between dollar forty dollar sixty five.
Over the next three years, we expect global oil supplies could potentially add two.two three.three million b/d from Iran, the Neutral Zone and Libya .

On the other hand, we expect US production could decline one hundred four hundred mb/d next year while the OPEC countries may decline by one hundred fifty two hundred mb/d per year, primarily driven by Venezuela and Nigeria.

In addition, we think non US, non OPEC production could drop one two percent, or three hundred six hundred mb/d by two thousand eighteen as major project sanctions have slowed to a near halt since late two thousand thirteen.
As a result, we estimate total available supplies in excess of current demand at two.one three.sixty
five mmb/d over the next three years compared to our estimate of potential demand growth of roughly three.sixty
This implies US production may need to increase by an average of one mmb/d in two thousand eighteen.
While we don't doubt the US's ability to grow production by one million b/d a year, the question is at what price level.
In our opinion, this is not a question of well economics, but one of liquidity.
At what price will domestic producers generate sufficient cash flow to fund drilling activities enough to increase output by one mmb/d?
Our best guess is that WTI prices will need to exceed dollar seventy dollar eighty/bl which implies Brent exceeding dollar seventy five dollar eighty five/bl by two thousand eighteen.

Low Scenario Current Global Supply Surplus Possible two thousand sixteen Production Supply Growth Iran Neutral Zone Libya Potential Reduction two thousand sixteen US decline Other OPEC countries Non US and Non OPEC Total Available Supplies Estimated Demand Growth* Potential Necessary US Production Response in two thousand seventeen two thousand eighteen *Assuming demand growth of one.two
Barclays | ConocoPhillips Positive risk factors to oil prices: Â· We expect global oil demand will continue to exceed expectation.

We view the risks of a Chinese economic implosion as minimal given the fact that policymakers still have at their disposal ample firepower to artificially address potential economic crises, such as stock market crashes or housing bubbles.

While the long term risks to the Chinese economy will only grow from such kicking the can down the road, the short to medium term interests of the policymakers should ensure any necessary stabilizing actions will be taken.
Thus, we see reduced risks of a China Hard Landing to the global oil market, at least for now.
We estimate global oil demand to grow one.nine million b/d in two thousand fifteen and conservatively estimate the annual growth rate will drop to one.two
one.four million b/d per annum between two thousand sixteen two thousand eighteen.
We expect sharp two thousand sixteen budget cuts to below their sustaining capital requirements by many US E and P companies.

While the market's focus until recently has rightfully been on the resilience of US oil production in the face of continued capex and rig cuts, we believe US oil production should remain in a sequential downtrend in the coming quarters.
Until recently, the credit market has been relatively generous toward struggling E and P companies.
However, as the high yield energy debt market dries up, many will come under increasing financial duress and production will be threatened.
Furthermore, we think that by two thousand sixteen we could potentially see the first signs of a production drop in the non OPEC/non US oil producers.
We think that Nigeria and Venezuela will continue their downward production trend.

Meanwhile, Iraqi production growth to recent records may reverse due to the government's call to international oil companies to suspend or draw down their two thousand sixteen work plans in order to save on costs .
We also think that Angola production could begin to trend lower reflecting the lack of new major projects being sanctioned since late two thousand thirteen.

Lastly, we think Russian production may trend flat to slightly down in two thousand sixteen due to the ongoing effects of sanctions, the delay of the planned cut in oil export duties, and the potential new oil tax plan that would increase mineral taxes.
Negative risk factors to oil prices: Â· We expect Iran will ramp up production faster and higher than the market's current assumption, ie, we think production could reach three.five
Â­ four. million b/d by the end of two thousand sixteen.
However, we do not believe the country could push much beyond four mmb/d over the next two three years.
Iran has repeatedly failed to achieve its target of reaching six mmb/d of capacity throughout the last thirty years.

The Neutral Zone could ramp up production to five hundred six hundred mb/d if Kuwait and Saudi Arabia resolve their differences and pave the way for Kuwait to resume the issuance of foreign work permits to Chevron.
million b/d over the next three years from currently three hundred four hundred mb/d even if the civil war continues.
All militant factions need foreign currency and oil is the only avenue for them.
We expect Libya to settle into an unstable equilibrium where different factions will control different parts of the country and avoid large scale all out wars.
Within their respective zones of influence, they will all pump oil as much as they can.
We think it is important to note that the potential production uplift from the Neutral Zone and Libya collectively is bigger than the potential uplift from Iran.

Despite our expectation that US onshore oil production will remain in a downward trend over the next several quarters, we expect imports to stay elevated due to rising floating storage costs, which in turn will lead to a buildup of crude inventories in PADDs two and three collectively by an average of three four million barrels per week.
Barclays | ConocoPhillips believe the US will actually run out of crude storage, we expect the inventory build will put downward pressure on WTI Cushing and US prices over the next several months.

Refining outlook On the refining side, while Barclays' US, European and Asian representative refining margin indicators' have plunged since reaching impressive near term highs during the summer of two thousand fifteen, each has recently posted its own modest respective recovery.
In fact, each of these margins is still above its respective two year seasonally adjusted average.

While we acknowledge they are threatened in the near term by the currently high global inventory levels, we think any inventories surplus or deficit could potentially be corrected relatively quickly as the current stock levels represent a fraction of the supply/demand balance.
Thus the inventory levels were never a useful indicator for the long term margin outlook.
Aiding US refining margins over the next several months, we believe, will be a modest widening of the North American crude oil differentials.

Although we expect US onshore oil production to continue trending lower at least through the first half of two thousand sixteen, we expect it to be outweighed by lower demand from refinery turnaround activities.

Perhaps more importantly, we believe imports will stay elevated, as we think the recent sharp rise of the VLCC tanker day rate will both widen the contango and alter the import economics from West Africa to the US Gulf Coast.
With the current global oversupply, onshore storage facilities in Africa and the North Sea are filling, with producers turning to floating storage.
But with the high VLCC rates, we expect much of these barrels to make their way into the US Gulf Coast, pressuring LLS into breakeven or dollar one dollar two/b discount versus Brent through.
This in turn should push WTI Cushing prices down to dollar three dollar five per barrel below Brent.
Please refer to our Valero threeQfifteen Earnings Review, dated twenty nine Oct, two thousand fifteen, for a more thorough refining industry macro analysis.

We think COP's threeQfifteen result will have a neutral to slightly negative impact on the shares' near term performance.

Despite the improving operating performance and the substantial cost reduction savings that has already been achieved, the market remains sceptical about the company's ability to achieve cash flow neutrality in two thousand seventeen under a dollar sixty Brent price environment.

While the reduced FYfifteen capital spending guidance in conjunction with a modestly higher FYfifteen production outlook is a good combination, we think investors will instead focus their attention towards the just announced Dec tenth conference call where the company will unveil its two thousand sixteen production/capex plan.
Given the market's concern, in hindsight, COP might be better off providing a preliminary budget and production outlook in the conference call, similar to what CVX decided to do.

Total threeQfifteen production averaged one thousand five hundred fifty four mboe/d, compared to guidance of one thousand five hundred ten Â­ one thousand five hundred fifty mboe/d, and our estimate of one thousand five hundred forty two mboe/d.
Unfortunately, the robust production performance did not translate into strong financial results.
Cash flow from operations before changes in working capital was only dollar one.six billion or an annual run rate of dollar six.four billion, compared to twoQfifteen at dollar two.three billion.
While oil prices were down q/q and COP's threeQ turnarounds hit relatively oil intensive production areas such as the UK and Alaska, we think this is causing concern among investors.
In other words, the market is questioning whether the company could actually reach cash flow neutrality by two thousand seventeen under a dollar sixty/bl Brent price environment.
We further believe that the last two rounds of small dividend increases are not an effective use of cash for the company .
Concerning their recent decision to completely exit from their deepwater exploration activities, we think it is a double edged sword.

While it will provide much needed medium term relief to their cash balance by easily saving dollar five hundred million per year in capital expenditure, it will possibly rob the company of an important source of resource growth over the long term.
Since it is impossible to rebuild an entire deepwater program in a short period of time, COP's decision will lead to a total exit from the deepwater at least through the next ten fifteen years.
It also indicated on the call that all deepwater water exploration activities would cease by two thousand seventeen, and its remaining undeveloped GOM acres would be divested.
That said, we continue to believe COP offers one of the better risk reward tradeoffs among the mega cap majors.
Based on our analyses, we estimate COP's free cash flow yield after capex could exceed CVX and XOM starting two thousand sixteen, while COP continues to trade at a substantial discount to its peers.
We also continue to believe its North America unconventional oil portfolio, which spans across the Eagle Ford, Bakken, and Permian plays, is unmatched among the Super Majors.

COP believes it has around sixteen billion barrels of resource producible at below dollar sixty/bl Brent and another eight billion boe could be produced between dollar sixty dollar seventy five Brent.
We also think that COP could indeed reach cash flow neutrality in two thousand seventeen under a dollar sixty dollar sixty five Brent price environment.
billion compared to sustaining capex of dollar eight billion and dividend of dollar three.seven billion.

We think COP's threeQfifteen result will have a neutral to slightly negative impact on the shares' near term performance.

Despite the improving operating performance and the substantial cost reduction savings that has already been achieved, the market remains sceptical about the company's ability to achieve cash flow neutrality in two thousand seventeen under a dollar sixty Brent price environment.

While the reduced FYfifteen capital spending guidance in conjunction with a modestly higher FYfifteen production outlook is a good combination, we think investors will instead focus their attention towards the just announced Dec tenth conference call where the company will unveil its two thousand sixteen production/capex plan.
That said, we continue to believe COP offers one of the better risk reward tradeoffs among the mega cap majors.
Based on our analyses, we estimate COP's free cash flow yield after capex could exceed CVX and XOM starting two thousand sixteen, while COP continues to trade at a substantial discount to its peers.
We also think that COP could indeed reach cash flow neutrality in two thousand seventeen under a dollar sixty dollar sixty five Brent price environment.

COP is currently running thirteen rigs: six EF, four Permian, four Bakken.
Management indicated on the call that maintaining the same rig count next year would translate to a three five percent decline in unconventionals production.
To maintain production flat in the EF and Bakken with today's volumes, COP would require seven eight rigs in the EF and five rigs in the Bakken.
Per year, each rig would require dollar one hundred fifty million.
D and C costs in the Lforty eight are lower by twenty thirty percent vs a year ago, driven fifty/fifty by efficiencies and industry deflation.
Results were encouraging from the Shenandoah appraisal, while Vernaccia and Gibson exploration wells are being drilled and it expects to start on Melmar this quarter.
In fourQfifteen, first oil is expected at CDfive and Drill Site twoS.
COP achieved first oil at CDfive and Drill Site twoS in October.
Alaska production expected to be flattish for the next few years.
Gumusut had its first major turnaround start in June of last quarter it was completed in threeQ head of schedule.
Peak production is expected in two thousand seventeen at one hundred fifty mb/d.
The Cheshire deepwater exploration well off Nova Scotia was spudded this quarter.
versus dollar three.eight billion in twoQfifteen and dollar five.four billion in threeQfourteen.

dot com or call two hundred twelve five million two hundred sixty one thousand seventy two.

The analysts responsible for preparing this research report have received compensation based upon various factors including the firm's total revenues, a portion of which is generated by investment banking activities.

Analysts regularly conduct site visits to view the material operations of covered companies, but Barclays policy prohibits them from accepting payment or reimbursement by any covered company of their travel expenses for such visits.

In order to access Barclays Research Conflict Management Policy Statement, please refer to: http://publicresearch.barcap
The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equitylinked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

B: An employee of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a director of this issuer.
C: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a market maker in equity securities issued by this issuer.
D: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past twelve months.
E: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate expects to receive or intends to seek compensation for investment banking services from this issuer within the next three months.
F: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate beneficially owned one percent or more of a class of equity securities of the issuer as of the end of the month prior to the research report's issuance.
G: One of the analysts on the coverage team owns shares of the common stock of this issuer.
H: This issuer beneficially owns five percent or more of any class of common equity securities of Barclays PLC.
I: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has a significant financial interest in the securities of this issuer.
J: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a liquidity provider and/or trades regularly in the securities of this issuer and/or in any related derivatives.
K: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has received non investment banking related compensation from this issuer within the past twelve months.
L: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, an investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
M: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
N: This issuer is, or during the past twelve months has been, a non investment banking client of Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate.
O: Barclays Capital Inc., through Barclays Market Makers, is a Designated Market Maker in this issuer's stock, which is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

At any given time, its associated Designated Market Maker may have long or short inventory position in the stock; and its associated Designated Market Maker may be on the opposite side of orders executed on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in the stock.

P: A partner, director or officer of Barclays Capital Canada Inc. has, during the preceding twelve months, provided services to the subject company for remuneration, other than normal course investment advisory or trade execution services.
Q: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is a Corporate Broker to this issuer.
R: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. and/or an affiliate has received compensation for investment banking services from this issuer in the past twelve months.
S: Barclays Capital Canada Inc. is a market maker in an equity or equity related security issued by this issuer.
T: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate is providing equity advisory services to this issuer.
U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non voting restricted shares.

W: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate should be assumed to be an actual beneficial owner of one percent or more of all the securities of this issuer as of the end of the month prior to the research report's issuance.
Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: Americas Integrated Oil Cenovus Energy Inc.
Exxon Mobil Corp. Imperial Oil Ltd. Petroleo Brasileiro S.A. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has two thousand seven hundred sixty six companies under coverage.

forty percent have been assigned an Equal Weight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Hold rating; forty three percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: two November two thousand fifteen twenty three Chevron Corporation Hess Corp. Murphy Oil Suncor Energy ConocoPhillips Husky Energy, Inc. Petroleo Brasileiro S.A.
Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .

A: Barclays Bank PLC and/or an affiliate has been lead manager or co lead manager of a publicly disclosed offer of securities of Chevron Corporation in the previous twelve months.

At any given time, its associated Designated Market Maker may have long or short inventory position in the stock; and its associated Designated Market Maker may be on the opposite side of orders executed on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in the stock.
Valuation Methodology: Using our net asset valuation framework, we assume a long term Brent and WTI price of dollar seventy five/bl and dollar sixty eight/bl, respectively.
In addition, we assign slightly higher premiums for chemicals and refiners when the company has historically shown higher returns compared to peers.
We also take into account our estimate of expected free cash flow and EV/after tax cash flow analysis in our assessment.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: Our earnings estimates are based on Barclays Research's current commodity price assumptions, including oil and gas prices, refining and marketing margins as well as chemical product margins.
Thus, results will be subject to change due to fluctuations in the macro commodity market environment.
